verses.text: Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Keep ye judgment, and do justice: For my salvation \add is\add* near to come, And my righteousness to be revealed.
Blessed \add is\add* the man \add that\add* doeth this, And the son of man \add that\add* layeth hold on it; That keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, And keepeth his hand from doing any evil.

Neither let the son of the stranger, that hath joined himself to the \sc Lord\sc*, speak, saying, The \sc Lord\sc* hath utterly separated me from his people: Neither let the eunuch say, Behold, I \add am\add* a dry tree.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* unto the eunuchs that keep my sabbaths, And choose \add the things\add* that please me, And take hold of my covenant;

Even unto them will I give in mine house and within my walls A place and a name better than \add of\add* sons and \add of\add* daughters: I will give them an everlasting name, that shall not be cut off.

Also the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the \sc Lord\sc*, To serve him, and to love the name of the \sc Lord\sc*, To be his servants, Every one that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, And taketh hold of my covenant;

Even them will I bring to my holy mountain, And make them joyful in my house of prayer: Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices \add shall be\add* accepted upon mine altar; For mine house shall be called a house of prayer for all people.
The Lord \sc God\sc* which gathereth the outcasts of Israel saith, Yet will I gather \add others\add* to him, besides those that are gathered unto him.
All ye beasts of the field, come to devour, \add Yea\add*, all ye beasts in the forest.
His watchmen \add are\add* blind: they are all ignorant, They \add are\add* all dumb dogs, they cannot bark; Sleeping, lying down, loving to slumber.

Yea, \add they are\add* greedy dogs \add which\add* can never have enough, And they \add are\add* shepherds \add that\add* cannot understand: They all look to their own way, Every one for his gain, from his quarter.
Come ye, \add say they\add*, I will fetch wine, And we will fill ourselves with strong drink; And to morrow shall be as this day, \add and\add* much more abundant.
